abstract: Harvey Araton On Pro Basketball column describes well-known divide between Eastern and Western Conferences as NBA season begins; notes that split may diminish as league continues moving toward shared successful style that features fast tempo and more 3-point shots.
lead_paragraph: The gulf between the East and West conferences persists, but, as Rod Thorn observes, the league should continue trending toward the current successful style, which means a fast tempo and more 3-point shots.

headline.main: N.B.A.’s Great East-West Divide Remains, but Styles of Play Evolve
headline.print_headline: Great East-West Divide Remains, but Styles of Play Evolve

snippet: The gulf between the East and West conferences persists, but, as Rod Thorn observes, the league should continue trending toward the current successful style, which means a fast tempo and more 3-point shots.
